page.title: 02WOODLAND AND TREE TYPES
page.content: {ECOLOGY - GREAT CANFIELD,} page 1 of 3 {Woodland.}There are a number of small woods and copses. The two main areas are:- 1){Broomshawbury {Wood},(6 1/2 acres) of mixed hardwood trees and thick undergrowth. Part was cleared and replanted with Japanese larch and cypress in 1982. Therest will be cleared and replanted likewise but also with beech, scots pine and laurel. 2){High Rodingbury Wood }(similar size to the above), consisting of a mixture of trees; still has many dead elms (Dutch elm disease in l970s). {The Largest Turkey Oak (reputed) }in U.K. is in Fitzjohns Lane. Other indigenous trees include Willow, Oak, Ash,Sycamore,Lime,Holly,Wild pear, Maple, Hornbeam, Yew, Walnut, Elder, Hawthorne, Acacia, Crabapple, Spruce and Silver birch.
